rComments: Oh, Louis.  This man is really, really smart and one of best speakers I have ever witnessed. Genius wit. Arrogant, but in a cute way. He is a lot of people's favorite prof. He's very open and grateful to student comments. Very cool.  Interested in pop culture.  You can talk to him for hours about Morrissey.

Going to his lectures: interesting, but all in all felt like a waste of time. Really doesn't care about his students. He often mocked or made fun of some. Course material/guidelines were ambiguous and unclear. I was only lucky to get a cool TA

He is definitely an excellent and interesting lecturer. He is very intelligent and well rounded, very funny and witty. I went to every lecture and didn't regret it. He requires extensive reading, and you HAVE to read in order to pass. He has very high expectations regarding writing and improvement. Overall, very interesting, but difficult.

Louis is an engaging lecturer, but not necessarily the best one. The tests really are something else--one question on the final was literally three consecutive words and you had to identify the author who wrote them. Overall, not an awful class, but definitely not a great one.

Had him for LTEL 103K, currently enrolled in LTEL 110I, which promises to be just as incredible. Louis is the best professor I've had at UCSC by FAR. The people who don't like him probably just don't get him. He's brilliant and his lectures are fascinating. Advice: TAKE NOTES ON EVERYTHING. You will be tested on it!

A talented speaker who knows a good book, but the most arrogant instructor I have had at UCSC. His exams are multiple choice questions focused on arbitrary details and 10-15 minutes to analyze expansive concepts like primitivism. His lectures are enjoyable but mostly explore personal interest and arbitrary tangents about less important novels.

Hands down, Louis is the greatest professor I've had at UC Santa Cruz.  His excellent orating skills and charming wit make every lecture a pleasure to attend.  You'll regret missing any of his epic speeches.  Although the class requires heavy reading at a fast pace, take it seriously and you will be blown away by the amount of useful knowledge you'

Probably the hardest class I've taken here...but one of the best. Professor is great speaker, I was unable to NOT pay attention. Assignments were rare, but difficult. Like I said, really hard, but he helps you, and it's and you feel real good you passed.

Professor Chude-Sokei is an amazing professor. I, for one, was glad that he encouraged students to talk and feel that the "name dropping" and "self glorifying literati" are actually positive traits, like the student doesn't just read what is required of them. Chude-sokei's lectures are always engaging and tons of fun. Take his classes!

Wish he would talk more than the self-glorifying literati in class would. Class was too much of pompous students name-dropping and generally being useless, which Chude chose to encourage rather than inhibit. Chude is also quite arrogant (which can be fun sometimes, others annoying) and presents a limited yet interesting view of literature.

Quite possibly the tightest professor at UCSC. Incredible speaker and this dude knows what he is talking about. Louis is a refreshing look at what academia as a whole might some day be. anyone who learns from this man is way lucky. If you take his the material in his classes as seriously as he does, you will become a more powerful thinker.
I enjoyed this class.  He is a pretty entertaining lecturer...The topic of the class was not my favorite but it was tolerable and pretty fun by the end because of him.

People adore him because he curses and acts hip during his lectures, but he's AWFUL. He is blatantly arrogant and does not CARE about any of his students. He lets the TAs handle all the work and gets visibly upset when approached with questions and then refers you to a TA. He's impatient, condescending, and RUDE. Gotta be honest: I hate him.
Very interesting professor..his conversation topics know no bounds.

Chude-Sokei was awesome. His class was tough in that the reading had to be done, but he taught his subject extremely well and had an overall great presence in the classroom. He was positive and helpful, and a great teacher. I recommend this class if you're willing to do the reading. Though my neighbor did none of it and pulled off the same grade...

race and lit class...great professor! if you like reading and do well on multiple choice tests definatly take the class! i got a B+, in spite of my TA, and thoroughly enjoyed every moment in lecture...its really engaging and you should do fineee

Louis is an amazing speaker, highly motivated and interesting. There was a LOT of reading, but he made it worth while. The books he chooses are hella interesting and deep. I highly recommend taking ANY of his classes. He's amaaaazing!
The most informed professor I have ever had.

Louis is way cool! His lectures are the kind that you never want to miss, so you'll be more disappointed than stoked if you're absent from his class. He's a lot of fun and really, really interesting. If you're a lit major, definitely take a class with him before you leave UCSC.

Hilarious, interesting lectures. Keeps whole class involved. You go through about a book a week, but try to keep up. Chose intriguing books I enjoyed but never would have picked up on my own. If you've done the reading prior to the lecture, the lecture will make so much more sense. Look up the terms, they're on the tests. I recommend the class.

Lewis is really cool.  His arrogance stems from his superiority over all of his students.  You are not as cool as Lewis is.  Take his class for the lectures, but be prepared to work.  Recommend sitting in on a lecture even if you don't take his class.

He is a very focused lecturer, and he's funny, but he's also arrogant and not clear on what some subjects are supposed to be like. It would seem as though he's a good speaker for things like conventions, but as a teacher he himself should take a class.

Taking his Race,Gender&SciFi course right now. thought it would be great. it's killing me. he looks jovial on the outside but he's really just an arrogant **** who isn't nearly as helpful as he wants to seem.
Cool cool guy. His lectures are AMAZING! Don't miss out on taking one of his classes, even if you aren't a literature major!

He is absolutely the best, most amazing professor ever to walk the face of planet earth.  UCSC better be thanking their lucky stars he is a member of the faculty.  If you don't take his class, you are missing out.

The class itself was not difficult if you had read eight short contemporary novels).  The midterm was difficult, but the final was on the easy side to make up for it.  Engaging lecturer, even if in his notes more than I'd like.  Good application of theory
Hard but interesting class, as for Chude-Sokei- he is the most interesting and absolute BEST lecturer I've had!! Recommend him highly!

Interesting class, but don't take anything by him unless u are actually interested in concentrating and working a little bit on his class each and every day. I took it for fun, and that didn't work out :( He knows his stuff though
very knowledgeable of the subject, casual tone but very intellegent and well read. one of the best class i ever took at UCSC! so take his class
No Comments
we can only aspire to his level of coolness.
Word.  This class was amazing.
He rocks, he knows it, and that's ok with me.
A lot of reading,  but funny and interesting teacher. Work is hard, you gotta learn to keep up with the work.

Great lecturer, but blatantly arrogant. Things he puts on exams: alternate names of texts not assigned for the class, lots of quotes, his own opinions. There is only one right answer, and that's his. He said to us before the exam: "I will not hesitate to fail your ass." You could do all the reading and attend all classes and still get a C.

Great professor! Very knowledgable and easy to talk to. Made me enthusiastic about a topic I was not originally thrilled with. Picked great books. Warning: he gives very hard exams. But if you do all the reading & secondary reading you will do fine. Very funny man, and very cool. Take his class!

Lectures were engaging and interesting, but this class was unclear as far as reading went. Gave clear lectures, but explanations on where we should be in reading/what book we should be on were unclear at times. Tough and lengthy exams, gives you midterm/final papers and exams all at once. But interesting topic. Don't take if you don't wanna work.

Oh my gosh is he hot or what!?! If you want eye candy and an empowering, intelligent, wonderfully interesting lecture, then take a class with this man. He is amazing. I am not kidding when I say I would be the mother of all of his children. They would look great and be extremely intelligent. On a serious note the class really was excellent as is he

Really interesting class, not very difficult with the theories considering its a 80 class. Do the readings and come to every class or else ur screwed on the tests. the tests are kinda tough. but he's a really great teacher, how many teachers are cooler than the students? well he is
mmm...so beautiful and so intelligent...

Ditto on the worst prof. ever.  He reads his lectures aloud (key word is "reads").  He only grades you on multiple choice tests (we're LIT MAJORS not science majors!).  And he is completely condescending, picks obvious favorites in the class and loves to talk about how he's a "media artist" from "San Francisco" and he loves to dis Santa Cruz.

he is a great teacher......hes not arrogant, hes just funny.......who cares if he makes fun of UCSC he was the****, dont miss any of his lectures that is the meat of the class, most of the Q's on the tests are from lecture, if you can do that it is a give
Louis is amazing. Hands down. Those who say otherwise are incredibly wrong.
No Comments
amazing and inspiring teacher!
Worst teacher ever.

His classes are very informative, even if most of the information comes straight from the texts. He is a great person to learn from, or better, yet, learn WITH. His approach to education is not top down, but sometimes he could have been a bit more of an educator. Learning from him is a great process, but do your part to contribute. Nice person too.

Louis is a mildly engaging, but intellectually unsatisfying lecturer.  His tests are not terribly difficult, if you attend lecture, but they don't encourage critical thinking.  If you want ease and entertainment, without much content, he's your man.

Class was composed of 2 tests and 3-4 short assignments. It's upper division, so don't expect to have your hand held through the coursework. Never miss lecture, pay attention to detail. He gives ample time for papers. Treats students as serious lit. scholars, not kindergardeners.

Despite his ability to rattle of the occasional good lecture, Lewis is arrogant, lazy and unresponsive to the needs of his students. If you want to be entertained a few times a week, he can do that, but don't expect a real education.

His lectures were good. He knew his material. However, he was LAZY about everything else. His tests were poorly made and tested 'what book is this  quote from' rather than Concepts and he was not available for help. It also took him MONTHS after everyone else to get an eval up.

At first he is very funny and witty.  Yet, as the quarter progressed he become more and more arogant and frankly a prick.  He dissed on all the students at UCSC regularly which came off as rude. Tests were not easy.  Many of the questions on both midterm and final were obscure.
Louis is an awesome teacher!!! I actually wanted to go to his lectures everyday. He is very coherent and knows exactly what he is talking about. His tests were quite hard, though.

Louis is a good lecturer but his midterms/finals are completely bogus. If you miss a single lecture there is probably some piece of random trivia you've missed and will haunt you on the final. You really don't have to bother reading for this class, just read the passages he talks about in class.

He is an arrogant jerk,and has this fan club that take all his classes and he just lectures to them.Write down all passages, cause that is all he tests on. Also gave me the wrong grade, doesn't care about teaching or students.

Great lecturer.  Interesting material.  Not too interested in interaction with students, so make sure you get to know the TA.  Detail-oriented tests, MAKE SURE YOU TAKE NOTE OF THE PASSAGES HE READS IN CLASS!!!
A great teacher.  Interesting text selection; elequent lectures.  Tests aren't all that hard; just read and pay attention.
No Comments
No Comments

The most intelligent, articulate professor I've ever had.  Great speaker.  Does not bother you with unnecessary essays and the like.  Just go to lecture, do the reading, and you'll do fine on the midterm and final.  Quite fond of cursing during lectures, which is always good fun.

Luis is an awesome professor.  His lectures are interesting and tests are reasonable. He really wants his students to do well and he offered an optional paper in place of the final. Pop Culture is a great class
great!
great

Louis is incredibly hot! this man knows his stuff! his lectures are absolutely intresting and never boring! he speaks with such eloquence and depth that you can't help but to fall in love with his intelligences. i recommend this class to everyone, if not for the subject then just for the aesthetics.

He knows his stuff. Good lecturer.  However, if you are a lit student, you will ponder to yourself about wether it is actually a lit class...no writing, whatsoever. your grade is based on three tests.

He's probably the most eloquent instructor I've ever had.  Very interesting guy, fond of saying "****."  Tests are difficult, but not impossible.  You need to go to all the lectures in order to pass, because he basically tells you what passages you will be tested on.
Awsome class, he makes the subject really interesting and fun. There are a lot of books but they are really good.
Cool Teacher, KNows his stuff

This class had no sections and tests instead of essays which I didn't like. Tne books we read were boring, but Louis's commentary on them absolutely fascinating and he took me to new heights of understanding about the world. And he's so hot.
Definitely the best lecturer I've had- he really knew  the material he was teaching and I looked fwd to all of the lectures.

he is definitely a good speaker, confident, but not arrogant. lectures are interesting and truly help yr understanding of the texts. two tests, and two essays that were quite open-ended and well-related to content. take it if you like literature and DRUGS
Excellent readings (although a lot), intriguing essays, and interesting lectures.

I must say I'm a bit disenchanted.  On the whole Louis is a very good lecturer.  The writing assignments in this class weren't the greatest.  He also tends to take Fridays off without extending the same courtesy to the class.
